m_szDocSumamry: Audi A7 h-tron review X large Print Hydrogen power technology, and its green motoring prospects, have fallen by the wayside of late in the wake of lithium ion’s growing ‘alt-power’ prominence. But fuel-cell tech is far from dead. A case in point is the A7 h-tron, Audi’s fourth generation of hydrogen-tech development. Audi’s latest zero emissions powertrain approach has turned away from more traditional liquid hydrogen methodology and towards compressed hydrogen. And it’s no mere pipedream.
